8. 
liquid is pouring into a container at a constant rate of 20 cm3 s–1 and is leaking out at a rate 
proportional to the volume of the liquid already in the container. 
 
(a) explain why, at time t seconds, the volume, v cm3, of liquid in the container satisfies the 
differential equation 
 
t
v
d
d
 = 20 – kv, 
 
 
 
where k is a positive constant. 
(2) 
 
the container is initially empty.

v = a + be–kt, 
 
 
giving the values of a and b in terms of k.
